q1 module¶

q1.alohomora(n, m)¶
Arguments:

‘n’: integer ‘m’: integer that divides n

Descripton:

Checkerboard pattern matrix

Return:

returns a checkerboard pattern matrix of dimension NxN which considers each block of dimension MxM as a cell for the pattern.

q1.avada_kedavra(my_list)¶
Arguments:

‘my_list’: a list of 25 integers

Descripton:

  1. Create an array ‘a0’ from this list ‘my_list’

  2. reshape a0 to create a 5X5 matrix a1

  3. change the central element of a1 to 0

  4. make a copy of a1 and flatten it (call it a1cpy)

  5. multiply each element of a1cpy by 0.7

q1.expelliarmus(arr, theta, axis)¶
Arguments:

‘arr’: float Ndarray; dim: Nx3, ‘theta’: float; 0≤theta<360 (in degrees) ‘axis’: str; axis ∈ {‘X’,’Y’,’Z’}

Descripton:

Rotate counter-clockwise by angle theta (rotate all N (3-dimensional) points of the matrix about the given axis)

Return:

float Ndarray; dim: Nx3

q1.glisseo(P, Q, R, S)¶
Arguments:

‘P’: string, eg. ‘2 2; 3 3’ ‘Q’: string, eg. ‘1 1; 4 4’ ‘R’: string, eg. ‘5 5; 6 6’ ‘S’: string, eg. ‘7 7; 8 8’

Descripton:

Interpret the string to matrix and return the numpy matrix in the form [[P`,Q`],[R`,S`]] as given in the problem statement

Return:

return the numpy matrix

q1.incendio(my_integer)¶
Arguments:

‘my_integer’: an even integer

Descripton:

  1. create an array ‘arng0’ of shape (3,2) containing consecutive even numbers starting from ‘my_integer’, arranged along rows

  2. create another array ‘arng1’ of shape ((4,3)) containing consecutive numbers starting from ‘my_integer’ arranged along columns

  3. multiply transpose of arng0 with transpose of arng1 to get mult0

  4. take min of mult0 along its rows and store it in v0

  5. reshape v0 to make it a column vector:

  6. square all the elements present in base0

  7. store the sum of all elements of base0 in ans

q1.reducio(X, W)¶
Arguments:

‘X’: Three dimensional matrix with shape => {B,S,F} ‘W’: Two dimensional matrix with shape => {N,F}

Descripton:

Perform matrix multiplication such that you get the result in desired shape

Return:

numpy matrix after performing batch matrix multiplication (i.e) ‘X’ @ ‘W’.T and transforming to shape {B,N,S}
